forwardSingleFetch.inputHeader: Enter an address, a city, and a province

reverseSingleFetch.inputHeader: Enter a Latitude and a Longitude

useLocationButton.header: Click to use your current location
useLocationButton.warning: Please note web location access must be authorized

landingPage.title: Welcome to Pelias Geocoder
landingPage.underHeader: We're excited to offer our in-house geolocation services, including batch geocoding, to ensure your data is accurate, cost-effective, secure, and transparent. This service is the essential starting point for a variety of analytical and spatial projects. Our process includes tech exploration, prototyping, refining based on user feedback, and expanding coverage to meet your needs.
landingPage.cardFlipCaption: By using our in-house solution, you can rely on trusted results without the risks and costs associated with external providers. Join us on this journey to improve efficiency and safeguard your data.

cardFlip.enhancedPrivacyPara: Ensuring data stays within PHAC's network
cardFlip.costSavingPara: Reduce expenses by avoiding third-party services.
cardFlip.traceabilityPara: Easily track and manage your data.
cardFlip.flexibilityPara: Adapt our services to fit your specific needs.

geocodingExplanation.title: Geocoding Results Explanation
geocodingExplanation.underTitlePara: When Pelias returns geocoding results, it uses different types of matches to determine the accuracy of the location.

matchTypes.title: Match types
matchTypes.exactPara: These matches are very accurate and pinpoint the exact location of an address.
matchTypes.centroidPara: These matches place the address at the center of a larger area, like a city or postal code region.
matchTypes.interpolationPara: These matches estimate the address location based on nearby known addresses or along road segments.

improvingAccuracy.title: Improving Geocoding Accuracy
improvingAccuracy.underTitle: To improve the accuracy of geocoding results, follow these steps

verifyAddress.title: Verify Address Format
verifyAddress.para: Ensure the address is in a standardized format.

spellingAbbrevs.title: Check Spelling and Abbreviations
spellingAbbrevs.para: Correct spelling errors and standardize abbreviations.

details.title: Include Relevant Details
details.para: Provide complete address details like unit numbers and building names.

splitIntoComponents.title: Split Civic Addresses into Components
splitIntoComponents.para: Break down addresses into street number, street name, city, province, etc.

billingualReqs.title: Consider Bilingual Requirements
billingualReqs.para: Handle bilingual addresses and special characters correctly.

standardDigraphs.title: Convert Provinces/Territories to Standard Digraphs
standardDigraphs.para: Use two-letter codes for provinces and territories.

specialChars.title: Remove Special Characters
specialChars.para: Clean data by removing non-alphanumeric characters.

lessAccurateMatch.title: Implications of Less Accurate Matches
lessAccurateMatch.underTitle: Less accurate matches, like centroid or interpolation matches, can impact spatial accuracy and limit the reliability of spatial analyses.
lessAccurateMatch.spatialAccuracyPara: Matches that are not exact may place addresses at centroids or interpolate along road segments, potentially misrepresenting spatial contexts.
lessAccurateMatch.limitedSpatialAccuracyPAra: Inaccurate geocoding matches can introduce errors in studies such as demographic analysis or emergency response planning.

geocodingExplanation.understandingGeocodingResultsPara: Geocoding is the process of converting addresses into geographic coordinates (like latitude and longitude). When you use a geocoding service like Pelias, you get structured output.

apiFeature.title: API Features
apiFeature.features: Represents the list of results you get from the geocoding service.
apiFeature.bbox: The bounding box of the feature, defining the area that includes the location.

geometry.coordinates: The latitude and longitude of the location in decimal degrees, based on WGS 1984.
geometry.type: The type of geometry (e.g., Point, Polygon).

properties.gid: A unique identifier for the location.
properties.locality_gid: The unique identifier for the locality (city or town).
properties.neighbourhood_gid: The unique identifier for the neighborhood.
properties.confidence: A score indicating how confident the service is about the accuracy of the location.
properties.locality: The locality (city or town) of the location.
properties.accuracy: The type of accuracy (e.g., rooftop, centroid).
properties.source: The data source of the location.
properties.label: A human-readable label for the location.
properties.layer: The layer or category of the feature (e.g., address, venue).
properties.region_gid: The unique identifier for the region.
properties.name: The name of the location.
properties.match_type: The type of match (e.g., exact, fallback, interpolated).
properties.id: A unique ID and source of the location.
properties.source_id: The source ID of the location.
properties.country_gid: The unique identifier for the country.
properties.county_gid: The unique identifier for the county.

python.title: Python API
python.pythonParagraph: Developing in-house geolocation services within PHAC to improve accuracy, precision, cost-effectiveness, security, and transparency. Phases include tech exploration, prototyping, refining based on user interaction, and expanding coverage. Advantages include enhanced privacy, cost savings, traceability, independence from external resources, flexibility, and modularity. Avoids reliance on third-party services, ensuring data stays within PHAC's network and reducing costs associated with external queries.

rshiny.title: R API
rshiny.rshinyParagraph: Developing in-house geolocation services within PHAC to improve accuracy, precision, cost-effectiveness, security, and transparency. Phases include tech exploration, prototyping, refining based on user interaction, and expanding coverage. Advantages include enhanced privacy, cost savings, traceability, independence from external resources, flexibility, and modularity. Avoids reliance on third-party services, ensuring data stays within PHAC's network and reducing costs associated with external queries.

landingPagePara: Developing in-house, geolocation services (i.e. 'batch geocoding') within PHAC ensuring accurate, cost-effective, secure, trusted, and transparency results as a common but important start of multiple analytical, spatial journeys. Phases include tech exploration, prototyping, refining based on user interaction, and expanding coverage. Advantages include enhanced privacy, cost savings, traceability, independence from external resources, flexibility, and modularity. Avoids reliance on third-party services, ensuring data stays within PHAC's network and reducing costs associated with external.
